intro: Psychotria divergens, commonly known as the "devil's weed," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species, many of which are found in the understory of rainforests. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and ethnobotanical research.
